intro: Erigeron sanguineus, commonly known as the redstem fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are often pink to reddish in color, and they bloom from late spring to early autumn. Erigeron sanguineus is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
